page.title: 11ODIHAM FIRS
page.content: The primary land cover is farmland, with crops other than grass. The secondary land cover is residential, mainly houses, with one, small, all purpose shop in West Street. There are a few fields of fertilised grass for silage. Odiham Firs is on the A32, Alton-Reading road. It is 400 feet above sea level. The Firs were planted to commemorate the lighting of the beacon at the time of the Spanish Armada. In 1977, a beacon was lit to celebrate the Silver Jubilee of Queen Elizabeth the Second. The main residential area is around the Recreation Ground, opposite to the Robert May's secondary school.There are some private houses at the Firs. Nearby are the married-quarters for service personel, stationed at R.A.F Odiham. Hart District Council owns the housing estate opposite to the school.
